job.title: Business Intelligence Business Objects SQL Developer (32539)
job.description:
Location: Remote (with occasional travel to Springfield, Illinois)

Contract: 12 months with possibly multiyear extension/s

Functional Description:

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a skilled and experienced BI BusinessObjects/SQL Developer to design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using SAP BusinessObjects and SQL. This role supports Medicaid/CHIP claims and other healthcare data systems, ensuring accurate reporting and data integrity for state and federal stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain BusinessObjects reports using Medicaid/CHIP claims and subsystem data.
  • Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries for data marts and reporting.
  • Create and manage BusinessObjects Universes and metadata layers.
  • Develop and maintain database systems to support efficient data storage and reporting.
  • Manage server backups and ensure system reliability.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and recommend technical solutions.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide regular project updates to customers and maintain strong communication.
  • Mentor junior team members and provide technical training as needed.
  • Stay current with emerging technologies and industry best practices.
  • Perform additional duties as required to support project and organizational goals.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in SAP BusinessObjects development and reporting including report Universe designing.
  • 5+ years of SQL development, including 4+ years of performance tuning.
  • 2+ years of experience in data warehouse projects.
  • 2+ years of experience with Teradata (v15+), including SQL Assistant.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work directly with clients.
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Strong team collaboration and adaptability.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience as Business Objects server administrator
  • Familiarity with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare-related applications.
  • Experience with Tableau or BusinessObjects version upgrades. 2025 Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/S

job.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer (32541)
job.description:
EDW Informatica ETL Developer

Job Title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Job Summary:

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. This opportunity will be an assent to the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.

This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources.
  • Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency.
  • Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems.
  • Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance.
  • Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members.
  • Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients.
  • Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities.

Required Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development.
  • 5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning.
  • 5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities.
  • 5+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience.
  • 2+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience.
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills.
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills. 2025 Page 1 of 2 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) ETL/Informatica Developer

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Residing in or near Springfield, IL.
  • 5+ years of data warehouse development experience.
  • 5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools.
  • 2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake.
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React).
  • Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager.
  • Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems.
  • Experience working in Agile environments.
  • Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems.

job.title: Legal Analyst Attorney (34082)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D. for a hybrid contract position.

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis MN

NOTE: MUST HAVE,

  • Understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.

job.title: MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant (34105)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a seasoned MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant to join their Integration and Data Management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for redesigning an existing integration model by introducing MuleSoft to interact with SAP systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to redesign integration architecture

  • Develop and implement MuleSoft solutions using Anypoint Platform

  • Build APIs, configure schedulers, and design event-based integration patterns

  • Leverage DataWeave for complex data mapping, transformation, and design

  • Integrate SAP systems with MuleSoft for seamless data exchange

  • Participate in Agile delivery cycles and contribute to architectural planning

  • Support CI/CD processes and version control using modern DevOps tools

Required Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in integration development roles

  • 4+ years of hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform

  • Expertise in MuleSoft APIs, configuration, customization, and patterns

  • Strong proficiency with DataWeave for advanced data mapping

  • Demonstrated experience integrating SAP using MuleSoft

  • Solid understanding of integration architecture and methodologies

  • Proven success delivering large-scale enterprise projects in Agile environments

  • Technical background in Java, HTML, XML, Kafka, GitHub Actions, Confluence, Jira

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

Additional Notes:

  • Preference for candidates located in Calgary with hybrid availability (3 days/week onsite)

  • Remote candidates across Canada will also be considered if not based in Calgary

job.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering (34107)
job.description:
We’re currently seeking a seasoned Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science, engineering, and operations. This role is ideal for someone who has not only mastered the craft of building and scaling ML solutions, but also knows how to put them into production, and keep them running smoothly.

What You’ll Be Doing:

The role is a mix of MLOps, platform development, and hands-on model engineering. You’ll be responsible for designing automated workflows that take ML models from development to deployment with minimal friction. This includes developing robust CI/CD pipelines (preferably using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions) and managing model lifecycle tasks such as versioning, monitoring, and retraining.

A large portion of your time will be spent working within Databricks—developing feature pipelines, optimizing model workflows, and integrating ML components with existing SaaS systems. You’ll also help migrate and scale models within an environment already hosting over 100 ML models, with another 25+ targeted for transition.

On the application side, you’ll work closely with data scientists to productionalize machine learning prototypes. You’ll select appropriate algorithms, build scalable ML systems using Python-based frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, and help tune and evaluate performance over time.

The Ideal Candidate Brings:
  • 5+ years of experience in software, data, or DevOps engineering roles—with at least 3 of those focused on MLOps or ML engineering.
  • Expertise in Python, and confidence working with key ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Hands-on experience working in the Microsoft Azure ecosystem—particularly Azure ML, AKS, and Azure DevOps.
  • Deep familiarity with Databricks (including Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark) is non-negotiable.
  • An understanding of infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform), version control, and CI/CD practices in ML workflows.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally across technical and business teams.
  • You must be located in Canada and able to work with Canadian teams.

Additional:
  • Certifications from Databricks or Microsoft (e.g., Azure Solution Architect).
  • Experience working with LLM libraries or frameworks like transformers, trl, or deepspeed.
  • Prior involvement in ML model migration projects or SaaS ML platform integration.
  • A consulting background or client-facing role where clear communication and stakeholder management were key.

job.title: RF Systems Engineer (32648)
job.description:
As a RF Systems Engineer, you’ll be responsible for simulating and modeling the terrestrial and in-orbit communication systems for Lightspeed and support the definition of the architecture.

Main Responsibilities

  • Simulate and model communication systems
  • Work with system architects, RF engineers, antenna engineers, User Terminal and Landing Station engineers, to partition functions between hardware and software domains
  • Model RF link performance and manage link budgets accounting for impairments through the different elements in the system
  • Derive specifications for RF links and RF and antenna subsystems
  • Characterize and analyze system performance. Develop and maintain performance budgets
  • Provide technical support to regulatory, coordination, and market access teams

Education & Experience Required

  • Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with emphasis in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience RF communication systems
  • Knowledge of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, single and multi-carrier techniques, modulation types such as PSK, APSK, QAM
  • Specific experience with modulation standard such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) methods
  • Good experience in MATLAB or other tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems

Specialized Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Experience performing analysis and simulation of communication systems
  • Thorough understanding of RF passive and active components
  • Good understanding of active antenna beam forming technologies including digital beam forming, and fast beam hopping
  • Experience characterizing radio performance at microwave frequencies, including rain fade and its effects on the communication links
  • Knowledge of RF transceiver architectures and digital communication theor

job.title: Software Developer, Sr. (32575)
job.description:
*Based in Canada

*Fully Remote (once per year travel within North America for team event)


Role Overview

We’re seeking a skilled software developer with strong experience in .NET to join a collaborative, distributed team. This position offers the chance to contribute to impactful projects, leverage modern cloud technologies, and work with a range of tools and frameworks in a supportive, growth-oriented environment.

Key Expectations

  • Apply solid software engineering principles and a strong understanding of core programming concepts.

  • Produce clean, efficient, and well-structured code in C#, JavaScript, and related technologies, following established standards and best practices.

  • Learn and adapt to evolving tools and platforms, including cloud services (e.g., Azure), SQL databases, containerization solutions, and front-end frameworks such as Angular.

  • Engage effectively in team discussions (English-speaking environment), providing and receiving constructive feedback.

  • Show initiative in problem-solving while knowing when to seek guidance.

  • Deliver quality work on time while maintaining attention to detail.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and test software solutions using .NET and related technologies.

  • Participate in code reviews, offering feedback on application logic, database queries, and UI components.

  • Diagnose and resolve issues spanning back-end services, databases, and front-end frameworks.

  • Contribute to technical documentation, including APIs, schemas, and system workflows.

  • Assist in more complex initiatives, such as cloud-based deployments using container technologies.

  • Stay current with development practices and tools, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization platforms.

  • Adhere to established workflows for source control (Git) and deployment processes.

job.title: Sr. Drupal Developer (34101)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Drupal Developer with deep experience in PHP and Drupal to lead and support the development of robust, scalable web solutions. The ideal candidate has a strong command of both front-end and back-end development, is comfortable working with a variety of contrib modules and custom code, and thrives in a collaborative, DevOps-driven environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of Drupal-based websites and applications.

  • Build and customize content types, views, and display logic using modules such as Display Suite and Webforms.

  • Develop custom modules and maintain high standards for coding practices, testing, and documentation.

  • Optimize site performance through Search API integrations with ElasticSearch.

  • Lead or support complex Drupal migrations using the Drupal Migrate module.

  • Apply and create patches to core and contrib modules as necessary.

  • Integrate and develop web services (RESTful APIs) and support external integrations.

  • Collaborate with front-end developers using JavaScript and CSS/Sass to create seamless user experiences.

  • Utilize container-based development environments using Docker DDEV or work in VirtualBox-based systems (e.g., AlmaLinux).

  • Manage source control, branching, and CI/CD pipelines using Git and GitHub Actions.

  • Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and DevOps discussions.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Drupal (7/8/9/10) and PHP development.

  • Expertise in a wide variety of contrib modules and custom module development.

  • Deep understanding of Drupal theming, content type customization, and site-building best practices.

  • Strong experience with Search API, ElasticSearch, and performance tuning.

  • Demonstrated knowledge of web services integration and Drupal migration workflows.

  • Competency with front-end technologies including JavaScript, CSS/Sass.

  • Proficiency with Docker DDEV or VirtualBox-based Linux environments (especially AlmaLinux).

  • Comfortable with Git, GitHub, and CI/CD pipelines.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience integrating with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM.

  • Familiarity with Azure Cloud environments.

  • Knowledge of C# and .NET development.

Personal Attributes:

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

  • Excellent communication and time management skills.

job.title: Workflow Application Engineer (32655)
job.description:
The team at Myticas Consulting is seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety o

We are seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety of platforms and applications, ensuring smooth integration, optimized performance, and high customer satisfaction.

  • Proficient in Java or scripting languages such as Python or Bash.

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.

  • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and adapting to emerging technologies.

job.title: DevOps Technical Analyst (32638)
job.description:
The team at Myticas Consulting is seeking a self-motivated Technical Analyst to support a long-term engagement with our non for profit client. This is a 2-year contract opportunity ideal for a DevOps-savvy analyst with a strong foundation in system analysis and cloud/infrastructure operations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have a passion for automation and modern DevOps practices, and be eager to take ownership in a hands-on technical role.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct system and integration analysis to ensure high performance and availability

Education:

job.title: Senior Data Warehouse Business Analyst (34075)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Springfield, IL in need of a Data Warehouse BA for a REMOTE, long-term contract. Travel to Springfield may be required 2-4 times/year. Qualified candidates please provide resume.

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, process flows, and reporting specifications.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
  • Support change management and training efforts related to new data solutions.
Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
  • Ability to effectively communicate findings clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.

job.title: FPGA Developer, Senior (32549)
job.description:
Overview:
A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a Senior FPGA Developer to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.

  • Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.

  • Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.

  • Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).

  • Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.

  • Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.

  • Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.

  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).

  • Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).

  • Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.

  • Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.

  • Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.

job.title: Senior Technical NetSuite Architect (34219)
job.description:
Senior Technical NetSuite Architect
Part-Time Contract | 20–30 Hours/Week | Remote (U.S.-based only)

Myticas Consulting is seeking a Senior Technical Architect with deep NetSuite ERP experience to support a long-term consulting engagement for a client in the advanced manufacturing space. This role will focus on architecting an ERP system for a network of pilot plants, helping lay the foundation for scalable and compliant manufacturing operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather and document business and technical requirements.

  • Guide ERP implementation partner selection.

  • Architect and oversee the design of a NetSuite ERP solution aligned with manufacturing needs.

  • Serve as a technical advisor throughout the implementation.

  • Collaborate with both internal teams and third-party vendors.

Qualifications:

  • 8+ years in ERP architecture, with hands-on NetSuite experience.

  • Strong understanding of manufacturing and supply chain workflows.

  • Experience working with implementation partners and cross-functional teams.

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • Must be located in the U.S.

Preferred:

  • Background in biotech, industrial manufacturing, or regulated industries.

  • Familiarity with compliance and data security best practices.

Apply today to connect with our team and learn more about this exciting opportunity.

job.title: Project Coordinator (34241)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Coordinator for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- Proven ability to assist in coordinating large, cross-functional teams and supporting high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills, with experience working alongside Agency Leadership.
- Ability to contribute to both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Experience supporting vendor-managed projects with integrated technical components and a variety of stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The client is seeking a skilled and organized Project Coordinator to support the planning and execution of complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of project management processes, effective coordination skills, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery, in alignment with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:
-Assist in coordinating one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring regular communication and coordination with stakeholders at various levels.
-Support adherence to client project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
-Aid in organizing cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the creation of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
-Track and report on project progress related to scope, quality, schedule, and budget. Highlight any potential issues or risks to senior leadership in a timely manner.
-Assist in planning long-term project milestones and releases to support organizational strategic goals, ensuring alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
-Collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to understand technical requirements, ensuring project activities align with business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
-Help implement structured change management practices, including supporting stakeholder engagement efforts to ensure the successful adoption of project deliverables.

Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a key role in supporting change adoption by:
-Assisting in integrating change management principles from the start of the project.
-Collaborating with stakeholder engagement teams to develop communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
-Supporting stakeholders at all levels to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure successful long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.

job.title: D365 Trainer - SharePoint (32662)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly experienced D365 Trainer with SharePoint expertise to support a national training and information management initiative. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 (D365), SharePoint (on-premise and online), and experience in developing training programs, videos, and instructional content for users across varied departments and time zones.
Mandatory Active SECRET clearance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver training videos and step-by-step guides for users on SharePoint (on-premise) and Defence 365 features.

  • Build and maintain a SharePoint Online Training site with how-to content, videos, and best practices.

  • Conduct training sessions for new Site Owners using training packages and sandbox environments.

  • Collaborate with the Communications (CO) and Information Management (IM) teams to design onboarding/orientation training for new team members.

  • Design and deploy Power Apps for automating team member intake forms and leadership processes.

  • Create an internal Wiki with approval workflows to replace DWAN-only resources on D365.

  • Support users in navigating the Microsoft Tenant environment post-launch.

  • Perform daily web administration for over 1,200 SharePoint sites.

  • Lead biweekly Information Management Working Groups and L1/L2 sessions to distribute updates and training.

  • Host monthly deployed Information Management sessions for field IMOs.

Qualifications:

  • Proven expertise in D365 and SharePoint (Online & On-Premise)

  • Experience in instructional design and e-learning/training video creation

job.title: Technical Manager Customer Support (32657)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team of skilled Technical Support Engineers in delivering world-class customer support. This individual will be responsible for managing daily support operations, coaching and mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and fostering a customer-first culture focused on satisfaction, retention, and long-term success.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technical support operations, experience with networking or SaaS platforms, and a genuine passion for solving customer issues with empathy and urgency.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead, inspire, and develop a team of Technical Support Engineers to deepen product knowledge, elevate support standards, and encourage professional growth.

  • Oversee daily operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance indicators (KPIs)—including customer satisfaction, response time, and resolution rate—are consistently met or exceeded.

  • Serve as the primary escalation point for complex or high-priority technical issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

  • Analyze support metrics, service-level agreements (SLAs), and customer feedback to identify trends and implement scalable improvements that enhance team efficiency and service quality.

  • Evaluate and adopt new tools and technologies that improve productivity and the overall customer support experience.

  • Foster employee development and retention through regular coaching, mentoring, and opportunities for continuous learning.

  • Drive consistency in support processes by promoting best practices, standardizing workflows, and maintaining high-quality documentation.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Customer Success, to address systemic issues and advocate for long-term product improvements.

  • Lead customer-facing support reviews and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to discuss issue trends, resolutions, and opportunities for service enhancements.

  • Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable improvements for product development and documentation.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • 7+ years of experience in technical support or customer success, including managing technical escalations.

  • Proven success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used for troubleshooting network-related issues.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field (or equivalent professional experience).

  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives in a high-pressure environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify risks and implement effective mitigation strategies.

job.title: Back-End Developer - Intermediate/Senior (32266)
job.description:
RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Adhere to company core standards & guidelines.

MUST HAVE/REQUIREMENTS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.

  • Strong database and query building knowledge across multiple databases, with experience in PostgreSQL and Oracle.
  • Experience with Apache Kafka for building real-time, scalable data pipelines and handling event-driven communication within microservices architectures.
  • Knowledge on Application Servers like JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic.
  • Domain knowledge of banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment will be a strong asset.
  • Proficient in core development tools such as Spring Boot, Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, JUnit, and Docker.
  • 5+ years of experience with enterprise software development.

  • Experience with enterprise software development in JAVA, J2EE, Spring (including Spring Boot), Hibernate, Web Services, MQ, REST-based APIs, Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka.
  • Strong experience in multi-threaded server-side Java programming, including Kafka producers and consumers to manage high-throughput messaging and event-driven systems.
  • Proven experience in the use of Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, and JUnit tools for development, testing, and continuous integration.
  • Experience working with agile methodologies, including continuous integration and deployment in Java-based microservices with Kafka as the backbone for event streaming.
  • Experience with Java development using JBuilder, Java, Servlets, EJB, J2EE, and frameworks like Spring, Hibernate, Struts, and Kafka for real-time event-driven architecture.
  • Proficiency in HTML, DHTML, JavaScript, XML, and CSS for building front-end interfaces, as well as integrating those with back-end Spring Boot APIs and Kafka for data synchronization.
  • Experience working with MS SQL, Oracle, DB2, OOAD, UML.
  • Ability to work in remote and/or office settings, with the flexibility to support offshore hours/time zones and adapt to client needs.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, while maintaining focus on product quality and timely delivery.
  • Flexibility with working hours based on team and client needs, including support for distributed teams and different time zones.

NICE TO HAVE
  • Strong, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and can foster team collaboration.
  • Out of the box thinking approach ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate to achieve positive outcomes
  • Detail-oriented and strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
  • Aptitude to solve problems
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions in analysis at all levels of organization
  • Pro-active and has a strong desire to learn.

job.title: IT Infrastructure Manager - Manufacturing (32619)

job.title: Director of Information Technology – Cloud Technology & Infrastructure (34234)
job.description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking IT leader to guide our technology operations and spearhead the strategic growth of our cloud-first environment. This role will oversee the planning, delivery, and continual improvement of enterprise IT services, with a strong focus on cloud platforms, SaaS applications, and modern infrastructure solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to shape technology direction in a dynamic, expanding organization while staying hands-on with critical initiatives.
The successful candidate will combine leadership, technical expertise, and business alignment to ensure our technology landscape remains secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. This is both a strategic and execution-focused position, requiring a proven ability to deliver results in a high-growth setting.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor, and inspire the IT team to foster innovation, accountability, and collaboration.

  • Oversee the delivery of IT projects such as infrastructure upgrades, security enhancements, and modernization programs.

  • Drive process improvements through automation, integration, and innovative technology solutions.
  • Establish and enforce IT policies, compliance measures, and security standards to protect organizational data and systems.
  • Partner with senior leadership to define and execute a technology roadmap that supports business growth.
  • Provide hands-on support for high-priority issues and initiatives to minimize operational disruptions.

Qualifications
  • 7+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud services, infrastructure, and enterprise technology ecosystems.
  • Strong technical foundation in networking, security, and systems administration.
  • Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT projects in evolving or scaling organizations.
  • Solid understanding of cybersecurity, compliance frameworks, and risk management practices.
  • Proven leadership and communication skills with the ability to inspire and manage high-performing teams.
  • Strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to align IT initiatives to business outcomes.

job.title: Full-Stack Developer (34085)
job.description:
We are seeking a Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Angular, Java/Spring Boot, and cloud-native development to join a purpose-driven organization.   • Build and deploy applications to cloud environments using Azure AKS, OpenShift, or Kubernetes.
  • Create and manage Helm charts for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Work with relational databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server to support application data needs.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability through automated testing, peer reviews, and adherence to development best practices.

  • Solid understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and writing performant SQL queries.

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, mission-focused team environment.

job.title: IT Business Analyst (34146)
job.description:
IT Business Analyst

We are seeking a highly motivated and self-driven individual to work in a complex and thriving global IT environment in support of the Toronto site, one of the largest vaccine research and development and manufacturing sites in the world. This role will report to the Digital Shop Floor Tools Lead and will be supporting all on-site manufacturing IT systems.

Location: North York ON (onsite 5 days a week)

Type: Contract

Duration: 12 months, long term contract renews every 1 year

Pay: $40 to $48 per hour CAD; $30-40 USD

Skills Required: The candidates must possess the following skills and this experience must be displayed on their resume: These are essential for seamless collaboration across different departments encompassing diverse skillsets and expertise, such as Digital, Operations, Automation, and Quality.

  • Must have WHMIS certification.
  • Must have a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have 2-6 years of providing in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals) in a manufacturing environment. These systems include the manufacturing execution system, data historian system, interfaces for integrated lab equipment, and related physical hardware/workstations.
  • Must have 2-6 years Business Analyst and support experience with computerized systems such as manufacturing execution systems, data historian systems, automation and control systems.
  • Good understanding of IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies.
  • Must be able to supply their own PPE. Requires CSA certified steel toe boots. If there is a need to enter a live construction area (as we have projects where the facilities are being renovated) there are additional PPE requirements such as safety helmet, safety glasses, and gloves.
  • The candidate for this role is expected to enter our manufacturing areas from time to time to provide on-the-floor support. As they will be entering live areas they may be exposed to Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus and Flu. They will need to be vaccinated for these to enter those areas.

Skills Preferred:

  • Knowledge and awareness of regulatory standards requirements from FDA and Health Canada particularly GXP, 21 CFR Part 11, Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures, Data Integrity Requirements and ALCOA applied to IT Systems would be an asset.
  • Experience with computer systems validation in pharmaceutical industry.
  • Ability to manage relationships with external vendors.

As an IT Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting on-site manufacturing IT systems from technical troubleshooting perspective as well as systems and process improvement perspective.

  • Natural curiosity and passion for technology, ability to quickly learn manufacturing processes, and strong organizational and time-management skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities, effective communication skills (technical writing, verbal, and presentation)
  • Self-driven with a passion for taking ownership for their work with the ability to prioritize and execute tasks from initiation to closure and a proven track record of successful independent work and self-sufficiency.

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership of manufacturing IT system issues from inception to resolution, collaborating closely with users and support teams to troubleshoot and resolve.
  • Escalate and coordinate with local infrastructure team, global support teams and vendor if required to provide timely support and resolution to various system issues.
  • Draft and maintain documentation in alignment with GxP and company processes as required by deviations / change controls, including but not limited to architecture specifications, installation procedures, and detailed specification documents.
  • Provide in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals).
  • Participate in on-call support for addressing system emergencies outside of regular business hours.
  • Drive system and process improvements to improve user experience and/or reduce required support and troubleshooting effort.

Location/Scope:

  • The job site is in Toronto, ON, Canada. Consistent on-site presence is mandatory for this role to facilitate troubleshooting and relationship management.
  • This role may occasionally require after-hours support availability to address system emergencies as the manufacturing facilities operate on a 24/7 basis. Overtime hours must be agreed with management.
  • Due to the nature of the job (production floor support) up to date vaccination and WHMIS certification is required.

job.title: Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (32444)
job.description:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.

job.title: Senior Manager, Radio System Engineering (32647)
job.description:
As the Senior Manager of Radio System Engineering, you will lead all technical aspects of radio system architecture, including air interface definition, concept of operations, functional specifications, and physical implementation of RF functions.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert-level leadership in RF system development, including trade-offs involving ACP, PAR, out-of-band emissions, pass-band ripple, group delay, and more.

  • Support the finalization of radio system implementation involving agile multi-beam phased array antennas and beam hopping technology.

  • Define operational concepts for all phases of the system lifecycle such as user terminal commissioning, network entry, satellite handovers, time synchronization, and adaptive coding and modulation (ACM).

  • Act as the principal architect for defining air interfaces between user terminals, ground infrastructure, and satellite payloads.

  • Collaborate with RF, antenna, system, and terminal engineers to partition functionality between hardware and software components.

  • Provide input to the system modeling team on design assumptions and strategies for modeling link performance, accounting for impairments across system components.

  • Work closely with the Verification and Test team to ensure thorough validation of requirements and system performance.

  • Participate in relevant industry standards forums (e.g., DVB) and provide strategic recommendations to align internal systems with evolving standards.

Education & Experience – Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Computer, or Systems Engineering.

  • 15+ years of experience in RF communications systems and/or RF equipment development.

  • Demonstrated experience taking RF systems from concept through iterative design, specification development, and low-rate production.

  • Strong background in system architecture, requirements management, and performance assessment for communication systems.

Education & Experience – Assets:

  • Familiarity with DVB standards such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2.

  • Solid understanding of digital communications, spread spectrum techniques, single and multi-carrier modulation (e.g., PSK, APSK, QAM).

  • Proficiency in MATLAB or equivalent tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems.

  • Deep knowledge of RF passive and active components and microwave frequency performance, including the effects of environmental factors such as rain fade.

  • Strong foundation in RF transceiver architecture and digital communication theory.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage stakeholders across engineering, management, and external partners.

  • Collaborative, adaptable, and capable of leading multidisciplinary teams in high-performance environments.

job.title: Sr Business Systems Analyst (32632)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Business Systems Analyst with QA experience at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 5 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description
The BSA/QA will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This individual will work closely with the project team and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and do document them in User Stories to then be developed. The BSA/QA will create test cases for user stories and will execute these tests and clearly documenting results and creating defects where needed.

  • Assist in the design and implementation of software solutions that meet the business needs and integrate with existing systems where necessary.

  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation including process flows, business rules, and user guides.
  • Work closely with project managers and other team members to ensure timely delivery of project milestones and resolution of any issues that may arise.
  • Serve as a liaison between the IT department and business units by communicating project status, changes, and potential impacts to stakeholders.

  • Extensive experience on different types of testing that includes Functional testing, System Integration testing, Regression testing and UAT.
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum Environments on multiple Projects.
  • Experience in developing test plans, strategies, and test Scenarios.
  • Create, execute, and maintain test cases and test scripts. Collaborate with the development team to address and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (34222)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience

job.title: SAP Data Migration Lead (34087)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking an experienced SAP Data Migration Lead for a high-impact, long-term contract with our client in the natural resources sector. This role is based in Vancouver, BC and follows a hybrid model with 20–30% travel.

The selected candidate will lead the data migration stream as part of an SAP S/4HANA and Ariba implementation. We’re looking for a hands-on leader who can architect, manage, and deliver high-quality data conversion solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the SAP S/4HANA and Ariba data migration stream

  • Manage data conversion activities across the full lifecycle: design, build, test, validation, cutover

  • Set up data migration technical architecture using Syniti ADMM

  • Provide technical direction to the data conversion team

  • Collaborate with functional teams to map and transform source data

  • Conduct data profiling, cleansing, and reconciliation

  • Develop and monitor data quality dashboards and pre/post-validation reports

Required Qualifications:

  • 5–10 years of SAP MDM/Data Migration experience

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer (32643)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - willing to consider all experience levels - this is a contract role to start, with conversion to perm the goal.


Planned 2nd shift hours of 4pm-12pm/1am, to support production.

Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts.   • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning

Required Skills and Competencies

job.title: Associate Business Systems Consultant (34100)
job.description:
Job Title: Associate Business Systems Consultant
Location: South San Francisco, CA (Hybrid-3 days Onsite/2 Remote)

Required Qualifications/Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years’ experience; Master’s Degree with 5 years’ experience; PhD with 0 years’ experience.
  • Pharma familiar and life science awareness
  • Linux and cloud familiarity

Job Description Summary:

Experienced Business Systems Consultant to work across multiple business areas (Precision Medicine, Genomic Research Center & Corporate Business & Strategy OIice) gathering requirements, helping the business to form strategy roadmaps and providing

informal project management duties.
Default point of contact for BTS with the business; brokers contracts between BTS and the business and resolves client and BTS relationship issues.
Manages and provides expert advice on, the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems. Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing technology components.
Translates business requirements into functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Elicits and communicates the organization’s business strategy; works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy.
  • Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

  • Proactively seek out strategic business opportunities with business unit executives for the application of new or existing technology capabilities.

  • strategies and technology directions. Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.

Identify process disconnects and translate them into improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits. Develops business relationships and integrates activities with other BTO's to ensure successful implementation and support of project eIorts.

  • Allies with other BTS functional areas to remain current on project status, and inform customer management of progress; conversely, keeps BTS managers aware of user issues and resolves conflicts.
  • Identifies the impact of any relevant statutory, internal or external regulations on the organization's use of information.
  • Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives of assignment. Has defined authority and responsibility for a significant area of work, including technical, financial and quality aspects. Establishes organizational objectives and delegates assignments.

Also accountable for communicating the business need and drivers to development groups to assure the implementation phase can fulfill the business need.

job.title: Lead & Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering (34110)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking a highly experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join a fast-paced, client-facing environment focused on delivering scalable ML solutions. This role is hands-on and deeply technical, involving the modernization and migration of mature ML models within a complex production ecosystem. You’ll be leading architectural efforts, implementing robust MLOps practices, and supporting the integration of ML applications into SaaS platforms. Strong communication skills are essential, as the position requires regular collaboration with stakeholders and mentoring of junior team members.
This opportunity is open exclusively to candidates located in Canada with a solid background in production-grade ML engineering—not recent graduates.

Role/Responsibilities
Platform Engineering & MLOps
  • Architect and deliver ML pipelines end-to-end using tools like Databricks and MLflow.
  • Create and maintain large-scale data processing and feature engineering workflows within Databricks.
  • Automate and manage the full ML lifecycle: model training, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Introduce CI/CD automation with platforms such as GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
  • Ensure high availability, security, and scalability across ML workflows.
  • Migrate models to SaaS environments and support cross-platform integrations.
Leadership & Collaboration
  • Act as a technical leader on ML-focused client engagements, driving delivery and alignment with business outcomes.
  • Translate strategic objectives into practical ML implementations and delivery roadmaps.
  • Partner with data scientists, engineers, and product stakeholders to embed ML models into production environments.
  • Mentor junior team members and champion ML engineering best practices across engagements.
ML Application Engineering
  • Convert experimental models into scalable, production-ready solutions.
  • Apply and optimize ML algorithms across a mix of structured and unstructured datasets.
  • Measure model performance, run experiments, and iterate for improvement.
  • Maintain documentation and contribute to internal knowledge-sharing frameworks.
  • Assist with the scale-up and migration of 25+ models in a production environment already housing over 100 ML models.

Experience
Mandatory
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field.
  • Strong academic and practical foundation in ML algorithms, distributed computing, and data engineering.
  • 5+ years in software/data/DevOps engineering roles, with 3+ years specifically in ML engineering or MLOps.
  • Demonstrated experience launching and managing machine learning solutions in production.
  • Expertise with Azure-based ecosystems (Azure ML, Data Lake, AKS, Azure DevOps).
  • Databricks proficiency is a must—especially working with Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark.
  • Advanced Python coding capabilities and experience with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools and infrastructure-as-code frameworks (e.g., Terraform).
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada and currently residing in the country.
Nice to Have
  • Certifications in Azure or Databricks (e.g., Databricks Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solution Architect).
  • Exposure to LLMs and frameworks like Transformers, TRL, or DeepSpeed.
  • Background in migrating ML models to SaaS platforms.
  • Prior experience in a consulting role, with a track record of effective client engagement.

job.title: Network Verification & Test Engineer (34227)
job.description:
We are seeking a Network Verification & Test Engineer to validate the performance, reliability, and compliance of advanced networking systems. This role involves creating verification plans, executing system-level tests, automating configurations, and working with industry-standard traffic generation tools. The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

job.title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst (34098)
job.description:
Title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst

Type: Direct Hire

Location: Lansing, Michigan

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a large, direct client seeking a skilled Cyber Posture Mgmt. Analyst I to join the team as part of their Information Security & Privacy team. This position provides security analysis for the company's Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operation's program. This role requires knowledge across multiple platforms, applications, processes, and procedures to enable access management of business initiatives across the enterprise.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Familiar with identity and access management, with a focus on Privileged Access Management (PAM), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).
  • Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization of IAM solutions.
  • Understanding of identity protocols and technologies: OpenID Connect (OIDC,) OAuth, SAML, AD-Fed, API Gateways, SCIM, and platforms such as, Sailpoint, CyberArk, and MS Entra.
  • Knowledge of identity & access management vulnerabilities, threats and mitigations.
  • Ability to determine how a security system works (including its resilience and dependability capabilities) and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect these outcomes.
  • Familiar with modern software life cycle development and automated cloud infrastructure deployment.
  • Understanding of network architecture, operating systems, and security protocols.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Supports initiatives and projects that will improve the organization’s cyber posture.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Understanding of security controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance (NIST CSF/SOX/GDPR/etc.).
  • Extended hours, including on-call may be required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to receive and incorporate feedback.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Flexibility in day-to-day work.
  • Ability to learn the company’s supported systems and their interfaces with other systems.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft software applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in an understandable fashion.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and execute efficiently and effectively while demonstrating a clear sense of urgency when appropriate.
  • Excellent customer service focus and skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment to achieve desired results.
  • Scripting knowledge preferred.

Qualifications

  • SC-300 Microsoft Certified Identity and Access Administrator Associate preferred.
  • CISSP Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred.

job.title: Digital Marketing Consultant (32563)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities. This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions. Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume. Thank you!
Job Description (Visible to Supplier): Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities

In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.

Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)
Reports to: Global SEO Lead

Key Responsibilities

Operational SEO Execution
• Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.
• Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.
• Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.
• Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.
• Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.
• Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.
• Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.

SEO Training and Enablement
• Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.
• Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.
• Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.
• Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.

Performance Monitoring and Insights
• Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.
• Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.
• Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.
• Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.

Collaboration and Coordination
• Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.
• Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.
• Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.

Tool and Vendor Support
• Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.
• Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.
• Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.

?

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.
• Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).
• Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.
• Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.
• Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).
• Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).
• Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

job.title: Business Development Leader (34233)

job.title: SAP Fiori Consultant (34230)

The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to streamline processes, enhance worker productivity, and ensure seamless integration with existing SAP systems.
Work Model: 100% Onsite –Ottawa, ON
Hours: Monday to Friday, 7.5 hours/day

  • Conduct detailed analysis of existing data systems and business processes

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and identify process optimization opportunities

job.title: Technical Manager, Professional Services (32658)
job.description:

The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, software integration, scripting, and solution architecture. They are passionate about translating customer needs into scalable, high-impact solutions while driving engineering excellence through mentorship, best practices, and cross-functional collaboration.

Core Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the Commercial Lead to align on project scope, milestones, and sprint planning.

The role focuses on data transformation and integration into legacy mainframe systems, supporting business-critical migration activities with high compliance and quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Previous experience with mainframe data integration or loading

Nice-to-Have:
